t: Stanley Black & Decker - Wikipedia
s: 3 days ago - 2016: Stanley Black & Decker announced in October that it acquired the Irwin, Lenox, and Hilmor tool brands for $1.95 billion from Newell Brands.

t: Here’s Why Stanley Black & Decker Bought Irwin and Lenox Tool Brands
s: Irwin and Lenox are valued as a ~$760M/year (the last 12 months at least) manufacturer of hand tools and power tool accessories. Together they also have a global footprint, much like many of Stanley Black & Decker’s brands, with a majority of sales in North America.

t: Surprise: Stanley Black & Decker Bought Irwin and Lenox Tool Brands
s: In a surprise move, or at least I was surprised, Stanley Black & Decker announced that it will be acquiring Newell’s tool businesses for $1.95 billion. The acquisitions will include Irwin and Lenox tool brands, and will presumably include child brands such as Vise Grip.

t: Black+Decker - Wikipedia
s: April 30, 2025 - 2012 – Stanley Black & Decker sells its Hardware and Home Improvement group (HHI) to Spectrum Brands. Sale includes the lock business, as well as the related manufacturing subsidirary in Taiwan (Tong Lung).

t: Stanley/Black and Decker to buy Irwin tools!
s: Stanley/Black and Decker who own Stanley, Black and Decker, DeWalt, Porter Cable, and Facom to name a few. Are hoping to own another large part of the hand tooling industry. They’ve put in a $1.95 Billion offer for Newell brands which owns Lenox, Hilmor, Dymo and Irwin tools.
